/wiki/Saharanpur_(Lok_Sabha_constituency: Saharanpur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (Lower house of the Parliament) constituencies in the state of Uttar Pradesh, India.
/wiki/Kairana_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Kairana Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Muzaffarnagar_(Lok_Sabha_constitue: Muzaffarnagar Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. Muzaffarnagar Lok Sabha constituency comprises five Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) segments. These are:
/wiki/Bijnor_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Bijnor Lok Sabha Constituency (Hindi: बिजनौर लोक सभा निर्वाचन क्षेत्र) is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India
/wiki/Nagina_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Nagina Lok Sabha constituency (Hindi: नगीना लोकसभा निर्वाचन क्षेत्र) is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India. This constituency came into existence in 2008, as a part of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.
/wiki/Moradabad_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Moradabad Lok Sabha constituency (Hindi: मुरादाबाद लोक सभा निर्वाचन क्षेत्र) is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in western Uttar Pradesh state in northern India. Formed before the 1952 elections, according to Election Commission of India 2009 data the total electorates in the Moradabad Parliamentary constituency (constituency number 6) were 1,388,525 of which 634,547 are females and 753,978 are males. The administrative headquarters of Moradabad district is situated in the city of Moradabad. It is located in the northern part of the state at a distance of 167 km from the national capital, New Delhi. Situated on the banks of the river Ramganga, this town lies at an average elevation of 198 meters. Hindi is the official language of Moradabad, though Urdu, Punjabi and English are widely spoken. According to the census data of 2011, Moradabad has a total population of 889,810 of which 53% are males and 47% are females. It has a sex ratio of 908 females per 1000 males. 12.4% of the population is below the age of six. The city of Moradabad has an average literacy of 70.65% with male literacy at 74.05% and female literacy at 66.90%. The economy of this city is primarily dependent on the Brass industry, the produces of which are exported worldwide. Moradabad has a promising number of notable universities, schools and colleges.
/wiki/Rampur_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Rampur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India.and it's the most powerful seat in the state of Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Sambhal_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Sambhal Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Amroha_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Amroha Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Meerut_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Meerut-Hapur Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. This constituency covers parts of Meerut and Hapur districts.
/wiki/Baghpat_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Baghpat Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (lower house of parliament) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in India. This constituency covers the entire Baghpat district and parts of Meerut, Ghaziabad districts and Shamli district. Satyapal Singh, former Commissioner of Police, Bombay, represents the constituency in Lok Sabha.it compromises 3 lakh 20 thousand jaat, 3 lakh 70 thousand muslim,1 lakh brahmin and 1 lakh 70 thousand gurjar about 1 lakh thakur and other OBC cast about 2 lakh SC (chamar jatav valmiki and other cast).
/wiki/Ghaziabad_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Ghaziabad Lok Sabha constituency (Hindi: ग़ाज़ियाबाद लोकसभा निर्वाचन क्षेत्र) is one of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India. This constituency came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.
/wiki/Gautam_Buddha_Nagar_(Lok_Sabha_con: Gautam Buddh Nagar (Lok Sabha constituency) is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India. This constituency, spread over Bulandshahr and Gautam Buddh Nagar districts came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.
/wiki/Bulandshahr_(Lok_Sabha_constituenc: Bulandshahr Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in Uttar Pradesh state in India.
/wiki/Aligarh_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Aligarh Lok Sabha constituency is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Hathras_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Hathras is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Mathura_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Mathura Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. This constituency covers the entire Mathura district. According to Election Commission of India 2009 reports,the Mathura Parliamentary constituency (constituency number 17) has a total of 1,341,649 electorates out of which 593,726 are females and 747,923 are males.
/wiki/Agra_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Agra Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.
/wiki/Fatehpur_Sikri_(Lok_Sabha_constitu: Fatehpur Sikri Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 80 Lok Sabha (parliamentary) constituencies in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. This constituency in Agra district came into existence in 2008 as a part of the implementation of delimitation of parliamentary constituencies based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted in 2002.
/wiki/Firozabad_(Lok_Sabha_constituency): Firozabad is a Lok Sabha parliamentary constituency in Uttar Pradesh.
